reviews.review_msg: Lectures are very boring and filled with a lot of material we didn't need to know for tests. Lectures are not recorded so i would recommend going. Coding projects were not bad and not harshly marked. Exams were similar to homework questions and he told us mostly exactly what would be on it. Overall a nice prof but bad lectures

Very boring and monotone lectures. And if the difficulty of the lectures was 2, then the exams would be 12. Not fun. 
Very tough grader.

This class was my first 300 level course, it was really bad. Can't stay focused for more than 10 minutes really boring. Get ready to study everything by yourself, exams are hard, the grading is crazy tough, but it isn't that hard to learn on your own, don't expect to learn that much. The way he replies to emails is unprofessional & annoying.

He is very knowledgeable in his area of research, and the topics taught are interesting. Thanks to the circumstances at SFU the difficulty was SIGNIFICANTLY lower - a lot of extensions and watered down quizzes. Textbook did a poor job at explaining things; slides might be better but not by a lot. Had to constantly refer to external sources.

He was a great professor. He really cares about the content and wants you to do as well. He is clear about his expectations and is fair at the end with grading. He is pretty strict with presentation and has high standard. You will be highly tested on what is said in class, so get ready to attend every session if you want a good result.

Pretty low effort prof. Bad lecture notes that are organized terribly. Very silly assignment deadlines and other course component deadlines at the same time in the same day (6pm lol). Intentionally feels like he makes easy content harder by doing a bad job of explaining it or assuming that the people he is teaching are knowledgeable on said topic.

Lectures are pretty dry and due to a lack of recordings, you have to go in-person to them. Assignments were pretty easy and exams were based off lectures + written assignments making them feel very fair. Overall, the class was informative and I enjoyed the assignments because they applied the topics we learned to real world applications.
Professor JC is really nice person. Hard work, then you can get what you expect.

Very informative. Course itself can be dry, but comprehensible. Read textbooks to get more background knowledge. He is clear on what he expects on exams. Overall, I enjoyed his lectures and his programming assignments were interesting too. Defitely doable!

First, take math 242 before this. It's not listed as a prereq but it should be. JC teaches the course with a focus on how to design multimedia applications rather than using them, which is really interesting. Lots of material but for exams you only need to remember what he stresses. The projects can be challenging. You get back what you put in.

JC is a quite helpful and nice prof. The two projects are related to the course content and you can learn a lot if you really put effort on them. The exam is fair and not difficult if you know concepts well.

He's wonderful. His midterms and finals are pretty easy. Almost two thirds students finished the final exam in just one hour. If you always attend his lectures, you will find that several final questions that look difficult have been discussed during lectures. You cannot benefit from that if you only attend few lectures.

All the material is covered in his lectures and slides. Exams are based on the assignment and the projects are not very difficult. The prof is helpful and can always reply your emails very soon. A quite nice and interesting Chinese guy:) I'd love to take his courses in the future.

Most things covered in lectures are not difficult. Midterms are based on the homework and his lecture slides. DO NEED to attend lectures as he will tell you what you need to memorize and how the exam will be organized. The projects are interesting and not that difficult.
Very good professor. I am now very interested in networking related works.

one of the best professors I have met. attending class is important since he will tell you  what will be covered in the exam . also, he is very glad to answer your questions and always replies your e-mail in 24 hours.
he's cute. anyway u never have 2 listen 2 his lectures, they r jus helpless. better spend time on the textbook and exams become so easy.

This class could be good.  Making JC teach it makes it horrible.  One of the worst profs I've had in my 4 years here.  He actually knows his material, but his assignments are so old that most people copy them, and his projects are useless and also mostly copied.  This means those of us who bust our asses to do it without cheating get penalized.

this prof is very smart,but he has hard time explain to students things himself understands well.And sometimes pronounce words wrong, like he pronounce "genuine" like "genius" .The exams are fair, but assignments and projects could be very time consuming I think if you r his graduate student, he will be more helpful.

Smart prof. but have a hard time explaining things. You're better off reading the book. Extremely easy assignments and relatively easy exam. You need not memorize or understand everything to pass. Though grading is low. Average and median grade of class is 85/86.
Good professor, and very easy course, seems that almost all students get 80+
Beware - 80% overall = C-
Wonderful professor! You should choose his courses without any hesitation!

The midterm was too long and I wasn't even close to finished. He gave an assignment due 2 days before the final, and a group project due after all the final exams. He was fair on the final grade though. If you plan on taking him, just be careful of this poor scheduling.

Somehow I thought he was going to teach another easy class.  I had him for MACM 101 and it was fine.  For CMPT 371, for some reason the class was just so ridiculously hard.  His exams are nothing like questions in the book or asked on the assignment.  I want to cry from his final.

Not so much an easy course, made especially tough by him. Lectures get kind of boring. Exams are extremely difficult, but he ends up bell-curving it a lot. He taught us materials that were not in MACM101 curriculum. However, I actually appreciated that he did so when I took MACM 201 (had an even worse prof). He's one of the more decent prof in SFU

he's well prepared for the lectures. no class before exams. the three assignments worth a lot. attending his lecture will make his powerpoint notes more clear. he gives in-lecture examples that appear in final. he scales the class quite a lot. he does not intend to fail anyone. final exam class average is 30% but he bell curves it to a B.
Worst possible person to have for MACM 101.

Lectures are all done in powerpoint, with the professor reading them off. Midterms and exams are very hard. This professor also taught us graph theory, which is not a part of the course, but in MACM201. This was not covered in the final exam, and was a giant waste of time. Before assignments are due, TAs would show students the answer book.

Very nice man. The average is around B. This course should be at an elementary level but JC sometimes didnot make himself quite understandable. Maybe slightly difficult for freshmen. But overall good prof and easy credit.

Lectures are very organized,notes are extremely helpful. Mid terms and assignments are so easy but the final is a killer,hard for most of the students, class avg around 35%, luckily I aced it and an easy A+ for me.
Very boring professor. Sometimes its really hard to stay awake in his class. He claims that that most difficult questions are easy. dont take MACM as long as he is  teaching.

Very poor lecturer. Extremely boring. Heavy chinese accent. It is not fair that students marks should suffer due to a bad professor. Apparently high quality education is a thing of the past. Faculty in the Computing Science at SFU is a joke.

If JC is teching MACM in the semester you want to take it, wait until the next semester when someone else teaches it. Or even try taking it by distance education. What I am trying to say is that JC Liu is a horrible, horrible professor.

His heavy accent is a bit distracting when you are constantly trying to figure out what he is saying throughout the whole lecture. There are profs that make sure the material they teach is clear and care if there student get it. JC is not one of those professors. Heads up.. Stay away.
Very boring lectures. The class content was actually supposed to be interesting, but he made it exceptionally bland!

His accent takes getting used to, but you'll be glad your in his macm101 class! His power points are very good and in lecture he actually does go into detail into the points which he tests you on.  So study the slides, listen to his lectures, do the assignments(practice/marked) and you should do well!  it takes practice, but once u get it its easy.

It takes awhile to get used to his accent but overall, it's a fairly easy course.  Powerpoint lecture notes are extremely helpful.  Sometimes it's hard to stay awake.    Make sure to go to class before midterms and finals.  He gave us some really good sample questions for the final which happened to pop up in some from on the final.

It's possible to do very well in this class without ever attending a lecture. (Lectures are incredibly boring; bring a pillow if you plan on attending.) PowerPoint notes are usually very clear and easy to understand. An good prof, if you have the will-power to actually listen to him during class.
Very good professor if you pay attention in class.  Takes a while to get used to his accent, but the powerpoint notes more than makes up for that.
He is a great prof compared to other profs in CS...
Hard to pay attention in class.

His own cell phone rings during class so he can't fault students when their phones ring. Rubbish as a prof. though. Only reason did well in the course is because I was taking Math 242 concurrently. Otherwise would have lost interest. Relatively ok exams, but harsh marking. Exceptionally smart but unable to bring himself down to 1st yr stud level.
He is obviously very intelligent but his english is poor and he is a poor orator as well.
This guy is so boring.  I hate his voice.  Falling asleep in class
Great Prof., very smart, very helpful, I recommend taking his graduate course on multimedia networking...
Unbelieveably easy!!!
